summary_gpt: Bata India received an assessment order from the Income Tax Department, including a demand notice and penalty proceedings for under-reporting income for FY 2022-23, but the company believes it can defend the matter without significant financial impact. The company has disclosed this information to the stock exchanges and uploaded it on its website.

Bata India Limited has announced a board meeting scheduled for May 28, 2025, to review and approve its audited financial results for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2025, and to consider a potential final dividend. The company is complying with SEBI regulations by providing prior notice of the meeting.

Bata India Limited confirms it is not classified as a Large Corporate under SEBI regulations and reports no outstanding borrowings as of March 31, 2025. The company has disclosed compliance details related to fund raising regulations and its financial status.

Bata India Limited confirms it is not classified as a Large Corporate under SEBI regulations and reports no outstanding borrowings as of March 31, 2025. The company also states that the applicable disclosures for large entities are not required for FY 2023-24.

Bata India Limited has updated the contact details of its Registrar and Share Transfer Agent to MUFG Intime India Private Limited, including new email and website information. The update has been communicated to stock exchanges and is available on the company's website.

Bata India Limited announced a change in senior management personnel, with Mr. Uttam Kumar appointed as Senior Vice President â€“ Merchandising & Replenishment and Mr. Satyam Sharma resigning from his role as Head - Merchandising, with Mr. Kandarp Asher transitioning to a new role within the company. The appointments and resignations are scheduled to take effect by July 31, 2025.
